text: good morning everyone
Good morning

guys, we want to organize our ember app into different components… now we have identified the components (so that if we have to built similar apps in the future we can re-use the code and so on). Now, what about models?
what’s the best way to share model definitions?
via a blueprint?
could you use mixins for that?
<@U0A48LWTG> Depending on how soon that future is you might want to consider looking into engines (<http://emberjs.com/blog/2016/09/08/ember-2-8-and-2-9-beta-released.html#toc_engines>)

attachments.title: Ember.js: Ember.js 2.8 and 2.9 Beta Released
attachments.text: Ember.js helps developers be more productive out of the box. Designed with developer ergonomics in mind, its friendly APIs help you get your job done—fast.

text: <@U03V2PZUB> we are also using engines, at the moment only for sing-in/sign-up stuff

<@U0A48LWTG> Re-reading the current scope of engines I'm not actually sure it would work anyway. Models is a tricky one. In a previous codebase we took the view that models shouldn't be shared and instead defined lazily (even if it was not DRY). Will be interested to hear where you end up.
<@U06BGNMBL> can you elaborate on your mixins idea? where would you define such mixins? and how would you use them?
It depends what you want to share - a mixin could bundle up some related methods, that called out to the Model where necessary
But if you're wanting to basically have a ready made API adapter layer, maybe engines would be better? Not looked at em yet
G'day
What does everyone use for tool-tips these days? Ideally not a JQuery wrapper
Got my own custom thing, but it’s not working with Glimmer2 and doesn’t seem to be a workaround from what I can tell, so looking to move to something a bit more robust!
thanks to everyone who made it to the ember project night yesterday.  It was good seeing you all there :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U044QMK6K> i've been meaning to build one for ages; nothing i've seen is perfect/great
I quite like the one that uses thether.js
<@U044QMK6K> what about Glimmer 2 is causing you problems?
<@U0C5RUAQ4> tether is a good system; which addon are your referring to?
let me find it
<https://github.com/sir-dunxalot/ember-tooltips>

text: this one uses ember-tether

and I found the API surface a little harder to work with than i wanted
still it's good

text: could be worth extending the addon if you think it can be improved
i did contribute to his repo
but then I had to move to something else
I'm sure its not the trendiest answer but for simple stuff I'd go with a css only solution.


not very descriptive
hate that those "black hole errors"

take out the whole thing; then add a line at a time back in :slightly_smiling_face:
starting with attrs and then reln
oh oh
wait wait
commenting out that message works

My tooltip is a tagless component, so it doesn't have an element, and I was looking up the parent element with `this._renderNode.contextualElement;` but that's gone in Glimmer 2 and has no alternative

attachments.fallback: [September 16th, 2016 11:34 AM] ksnyde: <@U044QMK6K> what about Glimmer 2 is causing you problems?
attachments.text: <@U044QMK6K> what about Glimmer 2 is causing you problems?

text: I had that so I could do things like `<button>{{tool-tip “foo”}}</button>` etc…
ember-tooltips looks ok, but a bit cumbersome `tooltip-on-element` vs `tooltip-on-component` etc…
yeah i have run into similar issues and the addon that <@U0C5RUAQ4> mentioned is the same
yeah that's what I thought
let me know if you do anything with this ... i'll do the same
we need a better answer for a basic UI pattern like this
should really be using CSS only tool-tips, but they don’t do auto-adjusting for when they are at screen boundaries etc do they?
I was using ember tether for that
i think the answer in an addon is to offer css-only but then also allow graduating to a more sophisticated solution where you need it
I might punt on it for now, make them non-tagless components and just hide the div with CSS so it doesn’t break the layout, then come back to this later!
:slightly_smiling_face:
punting is a popular option in our time starved world ... I may punt too
Ah, looks like ember-tether is broken in glimmer at the moment anyway, using it for a fair few things so that’s a bit of a dealbreaker
if I have: ```{{#tab-thing}} {{#tab-pane name=”X”}}{{/tab-pane}} {{/tab-thing}}```
if there any way to make `tab-pane` talk to `tab thing`
so that it enumerates all the child components?
<http://emberjs.com/api/classes/Ember.Component.html#method_nearestOfType>

`{{#tab-thing as |t|}} {{#t.pane name=”X”}}{{/t.pane}} {{/tab-thing}}`

they clean up so many things, no more child components walking the tree to find and register on the parent etc…
yeah glimmer is the sexy one but not sure the best one; i'll take both :wink:
